portraits.name: Photorealistic Portrait
portraits.description: A highly detailed portrait that aims to replicate the precise appearance of the subject as seen in real life.

portraits.name: Photorealistic Headshot
portraits.description: A detailed close-up of the face or head, mimicking the subject's real-life features with precision.

portraits.name: Classic Portrait
portraits.description: A traditional style of portrait where the subject is posed in a manner that highlights their best features and personality.

portraits.name: Candid Portrait
portraits.description: Captured without a posed appearance, showing the subject in a natural state, often unaware of the photograph being taken.

portraits.name: Environmental Portrait
portraits.description: Places the subject in a context or environment that tells a story about who they are or what they do.

portraits.name: Studio Portrait
portraits.description: A portrait taken in a controlled studio environment, allowing for precise lighting and background setups.

portraits.name: Headshot
portraits.description: A professional image of a person's face, often used for business profiles, acting, or social media.

portraits.name: Close-up Portrait
portraits.description: Focuses closely on the subject's features, typically framing the face or details of the face.

portraits.name: Fashion Portrait
portraits.description: Emphasizes clothing or accessories, often with the subject styled in fashionable attire.

portraits.name: Glamour Portrait
portraits.description: Aims to portray the subject in a visually appealing and often glamorous way, with emphasis on beauty.

portraits.name: Lifestyle Portrait
portraits.description: Shows an aspect of the subject's lifestyle or interests, often in a natural, everyday setting.

portraits.name: Fine Art Portrait
portraits.description: An artistic representation that focuses on the creative expression of the photographer, often with abstract elements.

portraits.name: Documentary Portrait
portraits.description: Captures the subject in real-life situations, often with the intent to tell a story or document a social issue.

portraits.name: Surreal Portrait
portraits.description: Incorporates elements of surrealism, presenting the subject in imaginative or fantastical settings.

portraits.name: Dramatic Portrait
portraits.description: Utilizes dramatic lighting or expressions to convey emotion or intensity.

portraits.name: Minimalist Portrait
portraits.description: Characterized by simplicity, using minimal elements to focus attention on the subject.

portraits.name: Moody Portrait
portraits.description: Conveys a mood or emotion through the use of lighting, color, and composition.

portraits.name: Character Portrait
portraits.description: Captures the essence or personality of the subject, often through detailed expressions or settings.

portraits.name: Head and Shoulders Portrait
portraits.description: Focuses on the subject from the head to the shoulders, capturing facial expressions and often used for professional purposes.

portraits.name: Three-Quarter Portrait
portraits.description: The subject is captured from head to mid-thigh, providing a broader view of their posture and clothing.

portraits.name: Full-Length Portrait
portraits.description: Shows the subject's entire body, often used to capture fashion or the entirety of the subject's attire.

portraits.name: High-Angle Portrait
portraits.description: Shot from a higher angle looking down on the subject, can create a sense of vulnerability or playfulness.

portraits.name: Low-Angle Portrait
portraits.description: Shot from below the subject's eye level, often imbuing the subject with a sense of power or dominance.

portraits.name: Profile Portrait
portraits.description: The subject is viewed from the side, highlighting the silhouette of the face from a lateral perspective.

portraits.name: Silhouette Portrait
portraits.description: The subject is backlit, appearing as a dark shape against a lighter background, emphasizing the outline.

portraits.name: High-Key Portrait
portraits.description: Characterized by bright lighting and minimal shadows, creating a light and airy feel.

portraits.name: Low-Key Portrait
portraits.description: Features predominantly dark tones and shadows for a moody or dramatic effect.

portraits.name: Rembrandt Portrait
portraits.description: Utilizes a lighting technique that creates a small triangle of light on the cheek, mimicking the style of Rembrandt paintings.

portraits.name: Split Lighting Portrait
portraits.description: Half of the subject's face is in shadow while the other half is well-lit, creating a dramatic contrast.

portraits.name: Loop Lighting Portrait
portraits.description: A lighting technique where the light creates a small shadow of the nose on the cheek, suitable for most faces.

portraits.name: Broad Lighting Portrait
portraits.description: The side of the face towards the camera is well-lit, often used to make faces appear broader.

portraits.name: Short Lighting Portrait
portraits.description: The side turned away from the camera is the most lit, creating depth and dimension.

portraits.name: Glamour Lighting Portrait
portraits.description: A lighting style that flatters the subject, often used in fashion and beauty photography.

portraits.name: Beauty Lighting Portrait
portraits.description: A soft, even light that illuminates the subject's face, minimizing shadows and imperfections.

portraits.name: Window Light Portrait
portraits.description: Uses natural light coming from a window to create soft, directional lighting.

portraits.name: Natural Light Portrait
portraits.description: Relies on sunlight or ambient light, often resulting in a more natural and soft appearance.

portraits.name: Outdoor Portrait
portraits.description: Taken outside, utilizing natural landscapes or urban settings as the backdrop.

portraits.name: Indoor Portrait
portraits.description: Shot inside, using interior settings for the background, and often involves artificial lighting.

portraits.name: Wildlife Portrait
portraits.description: Captures animals in their natural habitat, focusing on the face or entire body with a portrait-like quality.

portraits.name: Soulful Portrait
portraits.description: Aims to capture the essence and depth of the subject's character, often through expressive eyes or gestures.

portraits.name: Emotive Portrait
portraits.description: Focuses on conveying a strong emotion or feeling through the subject's facial expression or posture.

portraits.name: Expressive Portrait
portraits.description: Highlights the subject's expressions, capturing moments of laughter, sadness, or other emotions.

portraits.name: Intimate Portrait
portraits.description: Creates a sense of closeness and personal connection, often through close framing and soft lighting.
